item.title: Probability of death and length of stay using MIMIC dataset
item.description: Introduction The following project has two objectives: Predict the probability of death of a patient that is entering an ICU (Intensive Care Unit) using K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN) and Support Vector Machine (SVM) models. Predict the length of stay (in days) of a patient that is entering an ICU using decision tree, ensembles and neural networks models. Dataset description The dataset comes from MIMIC project (https://mimic.physionet.org/). MIMIC-III (Medical Information Mart for Intensive Care III) is a large, freely-available database comprising deidentified health-related data associated with over forty thousand patients who stayed in critical care units of the Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center between 2001 and 2012.
